pullrequest.title: Make CMake variables use versioned project name

content.raw:
I'm hoping this change will allow both ignition-math3 and ignition-math4 to coexist in the same CMakeProject. This situation is unlikely for a user to see, but it seems to happen pretty often during development. For example, it happens when a default branch major version of one ignition repo get's bumped, but the others aren't updated yet.

The problem with the alternative is the check at the top of the file on `@PKG_NAME@_CONFIG_INCLUDED`. It would still be `IGNITION_MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED` for both, so only the first found ign-math library would create variables. An extension to the alternative could be to change it to `@PKG_NAME@@PROJECT_MAJOR_VERSION@_CONFIG_INCLUDED`. This would only work if ignition-math4 was found first, since ignition-math4 would overwrite the ignition-math3 variables.
content.html:
I'm hoping this change will allow both ignition-math3 and ignition-math4 to coexist in the same CMakeProject. This situation is unlikely for a user to see, but it seems to happen pretty often during development. For example, it happens when a default branch major version of one ignition repo get's bumped, but the others aren't updated yet.

The problem with the alternative is the check at the top of the file on @PKG_NAME@_CONFIG_INCLUDED. It would still be IGNITION_MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED for both, so only the first found ign-math library would create variables. An extension to the alternative could be to change it to @PKG_NAME@@PROJECT_MAJOR_VERSION@_CONFIG_INCLUDED. This would only work if ignition-math4 was found first, since ignition-math4 would overwrite the ignition-math3 variables.

pullrequest.title: Make CMake variables use versioned project name
Make CMake variables use versioned project name

content.raw:
this is a logical consequence of our desire to have side-by-side versions of ignition libraries, but this specific aspect seems like a hassle for downstream developers, in that they would have to change cmake variable names throughout their whole project. I suppose one could create extra "namespaced" variables for each project and use those:

~~~
project(downstream)
find_package(ignition-mathX)
set(DOWNSTREAM_IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS IGNITION-MATHX_INCLUDE_DIRS)
include_directories(${DOWNSTREAM_IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS})
~~~
content.html:
this is a logical consequence of our desire to have side-by-side versions of ignition libraries, but this specific aspect seems like a hassle for downstream developers, in that they would have to change cmake variable names throughout their whole project. I suppose one could create extra "namespaced" variables for each project and use those:

project(downstream)
find_package(ignition-mathX)
set(DOWNSTREAM_IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS IGNITION-MATHX_INCLUDE_DIRS)
include_directories(${DOWNSTREAM_IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS})

pullrequest.title: Make CMake variables use versioned project name

content.raw:
I agree. Forcing this type of change on downstream developers is abnormal, and a bit burdensome. 

Also, side-by-side versions of a library does not mean they should also link in the same project. This is highly unusual, and doesn't seem like something we should support.
content.html:
I agree. Forcing this type of change on downstream developers is abnormal, and a bit burdensome.

Also, side-by-side versions of a library does not mean they should also link in the same project. This is highly unusual, and doesn't seem like something we should support.

pullrequest.title: Make CMake variables use versioned project name

content.raw: Being able to install side-by-side versions is just a benefit. The CMake variables needing to be versioned is a a consequence of the package name being `ignition-mathX` and not `ignition-math`. The [find_package](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/find_package.html) documentation is clear  in that the variables it sets are `<package>_*`, including `<package>_FOUND`. The CMake variables should match the package name, so either this project should keep the package name `ignition-mathX` and version the variables, or change the package name to `ignition-math` and keep the variables as is.
content.html: Being able to install side-by-side versions is just a benefit. The CMake variables needing to be versioned is a a consequence of the package name being ignition-mathX and not ignition-math. The find_package documentation is clear in that the variables it sets are <package>_*, including <package>_FOUND. The CMake variables should match the package name, so either this project should keep the package name ignition-mathX and version the variables, or change the package name to ignition-math and keep the variables as is.

pullrequest.title: Make CMake variables use versioned project name

content.raw:
I think we added the major version to the file name so that the `-dev` packages of different major versions could be installed without conflicting with each other

edit: if we change the package name to `ignition-math` does that mean the `-dev` packages can't be installed side-by-side? I mean currently they can't be installed side-by-side anyway, so I feel like I would be fine with changing the project name back to `ignition-math`, but it's a big change so we should be sure about it
content.html:
I think we added the major version to the file name so that the -dev packages of different major versions could be installed without conflicting with each other

edit: if we change the package name to ignition-math does that mean the -dev packages can't be installed side-by-side? I mean currently they can't be installed side-by-side anyway, so I feel like I would be fine with changing the project name back to ignition-math, but it's a big change so we should be sure about it
